trans-unit.source: Xenko 1.5 release notes
trans-unit.target: Xenko 1.5 release notes

trans-unit.source: Highlights
trans-unit.target: Highlights

trans-unit.source: Skeleton asset
trans-unit.target: Skeleton asset

trans-unit.source: A new Skeleton asset (*.xkskel) has been introduced. Both models and animations now hold a reference to a skeleton. This allows to reuse the same skeleton definition in multiple assets and to retarget models and animations to different skeletons.
trans-unit.target: A new Skeleton asset (*.xkskel) has been introduced. Both models and animations now hold a reference to a skeleton. This allows to reuse the same skeleton definition in multiple assets and to retarget models and animations to different skeletons.

trans-unit.source: Skeletons can be created alongside other assets, when importing an FBX file or other model format.
trans-unit.target: Skeletons can be created alongside other assets, when importing an FBX file or other model format.

trans-unit.source: Root motion support for models, cameras, lights, etc.
trans-unit.target: Root motion support for models, cameras, lights, etc.

trans-unit.source: Animations now apply root motion if they have no skeleton, or the ‘Root Motion’ property is enabled on the animation asset. The animation will then move the entity itself, instead of the skeleton's root bone. This is especially useful to import animations of lights, cameras or unskinned models, without the need to bind them to the bones of a skeleton.
trans-unit.target: Animations now apply root motion if they have no skeleton, or the ‘Root Motion’ property is enabled on the animation asset. The animation will then move the entity itself, instead of the skeleton's root bone. This is especially useful to import animations of lights, cameras or unskinned models, without the need to bind them to the bones of a skeleton.

trans-unit.source: The FBX importer will now also import animations of various camera parameters (near-plane, far-plane, field of view) and apply them to the CameraComponent of the animated entity. More properties may be supported in the future.
trans-unit.target: The FBX importer will now also import animations of various camera parameters (near-plane, far-plane, field of view) and apply them to the CameraComponent of the animated entity. More properties may be supported in the future.

trans-unit.source: New animation update system
trans-unit.target: New animation update system

trans-unit.source: The animation system now internally uses a new UpdateEngine to update objects. This allows us to animate arbitrary properties of entities, while accessing them in a highly efficient way. It will be the foundation for a future animation curve editor inside the GameStudio.
trans-unit.target: The animation system now internally uses a new UpdateEngine to update objects. This allows us to animate arbitrary properties of entities, while accessing them in a highly efficient way. It will be the foundation for a future animation curve editor inside the GameStudio.

trans-unit.source: The new ‘Animated Properties’ sample demonstrates how to create animations of any property from a script.
trans-unit.target: The new ‘Animated Properties’ sample demonstrates how to create animations of any property from a script.

trans-unit.source: Simple Profiling system
trans-unit.target: Simple Profiling system

trans-unit.source: It is now possible to visualize profiling information of all the game systems and custom profilers directly within your running games. To get started, use the Game Profiler built-in script, attach it to an entity and when the game is running press LCtrl-LShift-P.
trans-unit.target: It is now possible to visualize profiling information of all the game systems and custom profilers directly within your running games. To get started, use the Game Profiler built-in script, attach it to an entity and when the game is running press LCtrl-LShift-P.

trans-unit.source: Physic debug shapes at runtime
trans-unit.target: Physic debug shapes at runtime

trans-unit.source: It is now possible to enable the rendering of physics collider shapes during runtime. The debug shapes are normal entities and they must be enabled for each physics shape that requires it. The best way to start with this feature is to use the Physics Shapes Render built-in script and attach the script to any entity that has a Physics Component and when the game is running press LCtrl-LShift-P.
trans-unit.target: It is now possible to enable the rendering of physics collider shapes during runtime. The debug shapes are normal entities and they must be enabled for each physics shape that requires it. The best way to start with this feature is to use the Physics Shapes Render built-in script and attach the script to any entity that has a Physics Component and when the game is running press LCtrl-LShift-P.

trans-unit.source: Asset View
trans-unit.target: Asset View

trans-unit.source: The Asset view has been improved to help you better organize and manage your assets.
trans-unit.target: The Asset view has been improved to help you better organize and manage your assets.

trans-unit.source: New ‘view options’ menu
trans-unit.target: New ‘view options’ menu

trans-unit.source: The view options are gathered in a single menu accessible from the asset view toolbar.
trans-unit.target: The view options are gathered in a single menu accessible from the asset view toolbar.

trans-unit.source: You can display all the assets in the current folder only, in the current folder and its sub-folder. The third option let you display the assets and the sub folders.
trans-unit.target: You can display all the assets in the current folder only, in the current folder and its sub-folder. The third option let you display the assets and the sub folders.

trans-unit.source: You can also sort your assets by name, order, type or modification date.
trans-unit.target: You can also sort your assets by name, order, type or modification date.

trans-unit.source: New asset filter bar
trans-unit.target: New asset filter bar

trans-unit.source: With the new asset filter bar, you can filter your assets by name, tag, type or a combination of those. Each ‘filter tag’ can be disabled by a single click or removed from the active filters.
trans-unit.target: With the new asset filter bar, you can filter your assets by name, tag, type or a combination of those. Each ‘filter tag’ can be disabled by a single click or removed from the active filters.

trans-unit.source: To add a filter, type in the filter bar and matching filters will be displayed. Click on the one you want to add it to the list of active filters.
trans-unit.target: To add a filter, type in the filter bar and matching filters will be displayed. Click on the one you want to add it to the list of active filters.

trans-unit.source: Only the assets matching the active filters will be displayed in the asset view. Note that type filters are inclusive, while name and tag filters are exclusive.
trans-unit.target: Only the assets matching the active filters will be displayed in the asset view. Note that type filters are inclusive, while name and tag filters are exclusive.

trans-unit.source: Folder support in asset view
trans-unit.target: Folder support in asset view

trans-unit.source: If the ‘Assets and folder in selected folder’ options is selected, the first level of sub-folder will be displayed in the asset view. You can drag and drop assets inside them. You can also copy/paste complete folder structure.
trans-unit.target: If the ‘Assets and folder in selected folder’ options is selected, the first level of sub-folder will be displayed in the asset view. You can drag and drop assets inside them. You can also copy/paste complete folder structure.

trans-unit.source: Copy-paste assets with their dependencies
trans-unit.target: Copy-paste assets with their dependencies

trans-unit.source: You have now the ability to copy assets with their dependencies. To do that use the new entry ‘Copy with dependencies’ from the asset view context menu, or press Ctrl+Shift+C.
trans-unit.target: You have now the ability to copy assets with their dependencies. To do that use the new entry ‘Copy with dependencies’ from the asset view context menu, or press Ctrl+Shift+C.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you copy/paste a model with its dependencies, you will get a copy of this model along with a copy of all its dependencies (skeleton, materials, textures)
trans-unit.target: For example, if you copy/paste a model with its dependencies, you will get a copy of this model along with a copy of all its dependencies (skeleton, materials, textures)

trans-unit.source: Border and Center support in sprite sheet editor
trans-unit.target: Border and Center support in sprite sheet editor

trans-unit.source: For ‘Sprite2D’ sprites, you can move the position of the center by selecting the
trans-unit.target: For ‘Sprite2D’ sprites, you can move the position of the center by selecting the

trans-unit.source: icon in the toolbar of the sprite editor. Grab and move the cross to the desired position.
trans-unit.target: icon in the toolbar of the sprite editor. Grab and move the cross to the desired position.

trans-unit.source: For ‘UI’ sprites, you can change the borders by selecting the
trans-unit.target: For ‘UI’ sprites, you can change the borders by selecting the

trans-unit.source: icon in the toolbar of the sprite editor. You can then resize each border (left, top, right and bottom) separately in the same way as the texture region, by grabbing and moving one of them. Note that the
trans-unit.target: icon in the toolbar of the sprite editor. You can then resize each border (left, top, right and bottom) separately in the same way as the texture region, by grabbing and moving one of them. Note that the

trans-unit.source: icon lets you ‘lock’or ‘unlock’ the sprite borders while resizing the texture region.
trans-unit.target: icon lets you ‘lock’or ‘unlock’ the sprite borders while resizing the texture region.

trans-unit.source: New built-in scripts
trans-unit.target: New built-in scripts

trans-unit.source: We added a few more built-in scripts with this release such as an FPS camera script and First player controller script. To use them, just click on “New Asset”, “Script source code”, select the desired script and attach it to an adequate entity.
trans-unit.target: We added a few more built-in scripts with this release such as an FPS camera script and First player controller script. To use them, just click on “New Asset”, “Script source code”, select the desired script and attach it to an adequate entity.

trans-unit.source: Precompiled Sprite Fonts
trans-unit.target: Precompiled Sprite Fonts

trans-unit.source: Font rights are quite restrictive and it is quite common that only some persons of the project have access to the font files. This was preventing some people to build the game. To solve this problem, we created a new type of asset, the precompiled sprite fonts. It is an asset taking as input an image and containing all the glyph information required to render the set of character specified. Inside your games you can used it exactly like a standard sprite font. To generate a precompiled sprite font, the owner of the original font file just have to right click on an existing static font and choose “Generate Precompiled Font”.
trans-unit.target: Font rights are quite restrictive and it is quite common that only some persons of the project have access to the font files. This was preventing some people to build the game. To solve this problem, we created a new type of asset, the precompiled sprite fonts. It is an asset taking as input an image and containing all the glyph information required to render the set of character specified. Inside your games you can used it exactly like a standard sprite font. To generate a precompiled sprite font, the owner of the original font file just have to right click on an existing static font and choose “Generate Precompiled Font”.

trans-unit.target: Version 1.5.4-beta

trans-unit.target: Release date: 2016/03/03

trans-unit.target: Issues fixed

trans-unit.target: Fix a problem in the package upgrade erasing the content of shader and effect files.

trans-unit.source: Fix a crash in the resolution of invalid relative paths preventing to load the project in the editor.
trans-unit.target: Fix a crash in the resolution of invalid relative paths preventing to load the project in the editor.

trans-unit.source: Do not add pillar boxes when resizing the window of a landscape game under Windows 10 but readjust the size of the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Do not add pillar boxes when resizing the window of a landscape game under Windows 10 but readjust the size of the buffer.

trans-unit.source: Replace the MS Mincho font by an embedded free font in samples (The font is not available on every systems)
trans-unit.target: Replace the MS Mincho font by an embedded free font in samples (The font is not available on every systems)

trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Fix the issues preventing from passing Windows 10 store certification.
trans-unit.target: Fix the issues preventing from passing Windows 10 store certification.

trans-unit.target: Add support for proper resizing in Windows Universal Apps.

trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.target: Fix issues with the displayed values of rotations changing after validation.

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: The Connection Router script required to compile shaders on iOS devices has been fixed.
trans-unit.target: The Connection Router script required to compile shaders on iOS devices has been fixed.

trans-unit.source: Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Enhancements

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: Skybox compilation does not require a DX11 GPU anymore. We added DX10 support to ensure GameStudio works fine with less recent GPUs as well.
trans-unit.target: Skybox compilation does not require a DX11 GPU anymore. We added DX10 support to ensure GameStudio works fine with less recent GPUs as well.

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Add support for OpenGLES devices that do not support packed depth-stencil-formats.
trans-unit.target: Add support for OpenGLES devices that do not support packed depth-stencil-formats.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Add the possibility to edit the 3 components of a vector simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: Add the possibility to edit the 3 components of a vector simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Enhancements

trans-unit.source: Launcher
trans-unit.target: Launcher

trans-unit.source: Add a ‘reconnect’ button, in case the launcher was started in offline mode.
trans-unit.target: Add a ‘reconnect’ button, in case the launcher was started in offline mode.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: The asset creation menu always displays all possible assets to create, and switches to a proper location when the currently selected location is invalid for the chosen asset type.
trans-unit.target: The asset creation menu always displays all possible assets to create, and switches to a proper location when the currently selected location is invalid for the chosen asset type.

trans-unit.source: Improve animation thumbnail and preview. Automatically detect and use the corresponding model.
trans-unit.target: Improve animation thumbnail and preview. Automatically detect and use the corresponding model.

trans-unit.source: Improve asset filtering in the asset view. Filter tag can be added, disabled or removed at any time.
trans-unit.target: Improve asset filtering in the asset view. Filter tag can be added, disabled or removed at any time.

trans-unit.source: Folders are displayed in the asset view.
trans-unit.target: Folders are displayed in the asset view.

trans-unit.source: Assets can be sorted by last modification date.
trans-unit.target: Assets can be sorted by last modification date.

trans-unit.source: Add ability to copy/paste assets with their dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Add ability to copy/paste assets with their dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Improve the sprite sheet editor. Resizing borders or moving the texture region behaves correctly, especially when reaching the borders of the image. Background outside of the selected texture region can be darkened.
trans-unit.target: Improve the sprite sheet editor. Resizing borders or moving the texture region behaves correctly, especially when reaching the borders of the image. Background outside of the selected texture region can be darkened.

trans-unit.source: Sprite sheet preview can be displayed while the sprite sheet is being edited.
trans-unit.target: Sprite sheet preview can be displayed while the sprite sheet is being edited.

trans-unit.source: Change message dialog style. Some confirmation dialogs (e.g. deleting an asset) can be disabled in the settings (under Interface/Ask confirmation…).
trans-unit.target: Change message dialog style. Some confirmation dialogs (e.g. deleting an asset) can be disabled in the settings (under Interface/Ask confirmation…).
